document.docAuthor: Mejdalani, Gabriel, Domahovski, Alexandre C. & Cavichioli, Rodney R.
document.docTitle: Aguana picinguaba Mejdalani & Domahovski & Cavichioli 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: The sharpshooter genus Aguana: taxonomic notes, two new species from Brazil, the female of A. imbricata, and updated key (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The sharpshooter genus Aguana: taxonomic notes, two new species from Brazil, the female of A. imbricata, and updated key (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellini)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 30–40.
Aguana picinguaba
sp. nov.
, male. 30. Body, dorsal view. 31. Body, lateral view. 32. Face, frontal view. 33. Genital capsule, lateral view. 34. Pygofer process, ventral view. 35. Valve and subgenital plate, ventral view. 36. Connective and style, dorsal view. 37. Paraphyses, ventral view. 38. Aedeagus, lateral view. 39. Aedeagus, ventral view. 40. Surface of the membranous structure associated with the aedeagus.

FIGURES 41–50.
Aguana picinguaba
sp. nov.
, female. 41. Distal portion of abdomen (contour of sternite VII highlighted), ventral view. 42. Distal portion of abdomen, lateral view. 43. First valvifer, lateral view. 44. First valvifer and first valvula, lateral view. 45. Apical portion of first valvula. 46–48. Second valvula. 46. Lateral view. 47. Teeth at basal portion. 48. Apical portion. 49. Second valvifer and gonoplac, lateral view. 50. Apical portion of gonoplac.

subSubSection.paragraph: Head and thorax ( Figs 30–32 ) much as described by Young (1977: 37) for the genus and in the diagnosis given above. Color as in Figs 30–32 ; apical half of crown black at center; forewing vermiculations and spots and larger posterior spots predominantly red.

Material examined.
Holotype ♂ : “ Parque Estadual da Serra \ do Mar , Picinguaba , Ubatuba, SP [ State of São Paulo ]
28-30/X/2004
\ Mejdalani , Carvalho & \ Baptista ” ( MNRJ )
.
Paratypes : 5 ♂ , same data as the holotype
,
2 ♂ ( MNRJ )
,
2 ♂ ( DZRJ )
, and
1 ♂ ( DZUP )
; 2 ♂ , 2 ♀ , and
1 specimen without abdomen, “PICINGUABA \ UBATUBA- SP \
16/XII/1992
\ M. FELIX col.” ( DZRJ , 1 ♂ DZUP , 1 ♀ MNRJ )
;
1 ♂ , “ Lumiar , [ State of] Rio de Janeiro \ 22˚21’S 42˚12’W \
16/XI/2006
V.P. Alecrim ” ( DZUP )
;
1 ♂ , “ São Bento do Sul , Rio \ Natal Sta [ State of Santa ] Catarina
700m
\
01/II/2008
P.C. Grossi ” ( DZUP )
.
Etymology. The species epithet refers to the type locality (Picinguaba) in the Parque Estadual da Serra do Mar, State of São Paulo , Southeastern Brazil .
